text: Stimulation of mature peripheral T cells by TCR engagement results in activation of signals that drive induction of cytokine gene expression and clonal expansion .
However , under some conditions , engagement of the TCR leads instead to apoptosis .

Recent studies demonstrate that TCR - stimulated apoptosis requires expression of <extra_id_0> CD95 ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on activated T cells followed by an interaction between <extra_id_0> CD95 ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the <extra_id_0> CD95 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptor also expressed on this population .

Using a previously described mutant of the Jurkat T cell line , we show that proximal signaling events dependent on the presence of the <extra_id_0> CD45 tyrosine phosphatase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are required for TCR - stimulated <extra_id_0> CD95 ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .
